langmaterial.language: The materials are primarily in Romanian. Some materials are in Yiddish and Hebrew.

did.abstract: A collection of manuscripts and printed documents from the Jewish community of Botosani, located in northern Romania, from the first third of the twentieth century. The materials include items concerning communal institutions, such as the Jewish hospital, school, burial society and cemetery, and many documents related to decisions of the community council. The collection also includes large printed broadsides with names and information concerning local elections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of manuscripts and printed documents from the Jewish community of Botosani, located in northern Romania, from the first third of the twentieth century. The materials include items concerning communal institutions, such as the Jewish hospital, school, burial society and cemetery, and many documents related to decisions of the community council. The collection also includes large printed broadsides with names and information concerning local elections.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by document type.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection on the Jewish community of Botosani, Romania (MS 2028). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Judaica Collection Curator, 2015. Some of the materials were originally purchased from Vinograd and Rosenfeld on the Arthur D. Krom Fund in 2007. Additional documents were purchased from Vinograd and Rosenfeld on the Andrew D. Ball Book Fund and the Roland Book Fund in Judaic Studies in 2012. This material was acquired by the vendor from R. Osher Zelig Koenig, a collector of material on the Jews of Romania.
